results.title: Uranus, Neptune and Pluto
results.creator_credit: David P. Stone and Coastal Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 24 of Series “Universe: the infinite frontier: an introductory astronomy telecourse”.
William Herschel dicovered the planet Uranus in the late 1700’s. In 1986, the satellite Voyager flew past and sent back pictures of this ice planet. Neptune and Uranus have similar composition, but Uranus, unlike other planets, has an unusual rotation and large tilt, where it may have been hit by a celestial object. Uranus has rings and around it floats the debris from the formation of the solar system. Neptune, although similar to Uranus, has a different atmosphere and a dark spot, similar to Jupiter, as well as thin ring arcs. Triton, one of Neptune’s moons, is the coldest place in the solar system. Pluto was the last planet to be discovered, and because Voyager did not pass by, scientists have had to use other methods such as spectroscopy to determine its composition. It is the smallest planet in our solar system and may be a remanant of planet formation when the solar system was first formed.

results.title: Up pill, down pill
results.creator_credit: J. Gary Mitchell and Bailey Film Productions
results.brief_description: An open-ended dramatisation that explores different lifestyles - lifestyles through which the central figures try to adjust to disappointments and frustrations. For two young men pills offer an escape from life, in contrast Charlie, an old man who objects to being retired, pours his energies into a derelict boat. Designed to stimulate discussion of the type of decisions young people must make.

results.title: Up by Kosciusko's side
results.brief_description: The Snowy Mountains Scheme - its aims and scope; the main power stations and dams; planning and working on the Scheme; building the dams; drilling the rock tunnels; hydrographers and surveyors at work; the hydraulics laboratory; construction towns; remote camps supplied by air; the men of the Scheme and the pioneering spirit among them.

results.title: Up against the system
results.creator_credit: Terence Macartney-Filgate, George C. Stoney and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: People on welfare are rarely heard. What do they go through? How do they feel? How do concerned social and welfare workers feel about the welfare system? What is welfare supposed to do? In this film, welfare recipients and social case workers talk about the problems of being “up against the system.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: Terence Macartney-Filgate, George C. Stoney and ONF | NFB

results.title: Unusual artists
results.brief_description: Extraordinary painter: Earl Bailly, a Nova Scotia artist, holds the brush with his teeth. Sculptures in ice: Montreal chefs chip and chisel to see who can carve the prize-winning sculpture from a block of ice. Portraits in wool: Elizabeth Lefort keeps alive an ancient Acadian craft, creating beautiful tapestries.
